data.title: Save your money
data.text: We read reviews for this Resturant and we were hoping it lived up to the CT tradition of some of the best Pizza on the planet. But alas, in the land of the blind, the one man is king. What a let down. Pizza spicy, not juicy and crust brittle. No match to the top Connecticut Pizzerias. Resturant itself is nice, service quick and friendly. Beer and wine menu decent but a frozen pizza at home has a better chance to satisfy

data.title: Heavenly Pizzas!
data.text:
Their handmade thin crust personal pizzas are to die for, what ever toppings you choose!! I love them so much that I've never been able to convince myself to order for anything else! But considering the tasty pizza, I'm almost sure all their food tastes just as good. I love the setting as well.. just the perfect size of crowd around and my darlings husband's hands in mine :) 

P.S. If you're wondering what to do with left over pizza, worry not; it tastes even better the next day!

data.title: Great thin crust pizza
data.text: A great casual spot for couples, or families. The thin crust pizzas are excellent- very fresh and innovative toppings.

data.title: Great Pizza and Desserts
data.text:
Been a frequent visitor to Fat Cat since it opened and it has maintained an excellent level of food, service and atmosphere for years.  The founders/owners have done a remarkable job of staying true to their vision of pizza, desserts and wine.

The pizza is a super thin crust style that is remarkably firm, regardless of what toppings you put on.  The sausage is outstanding and their hot peppers are flavourful and full of heat.

Desserts and the wine selection round out the menu, (although recently they have added lasagna), both of which complement the pizza.  They offer a tight but excellent beer menu as well, but the wines are excellent.  Their Fat Cat variety, sourced from California, is our go to.  

We go at least twice a month either as a family or with friends.  The menu and atmosphere work for both.

data.title: Family birthday
data.text: I have always enjoyed the food and wine here. It was one of my favorites. This time, the service was nonexistent, they got the orders wrong, pizza was cold, salad had none of the extra ingredients it was supposed to have. We had to call the manager who agreed with our assessment and did not charge us for dinner which was admirable. We never did the the correct orders. No one wanted to try it again on another night. However, it ruined our celebration to the extent we have never returned. Very disappointed.

data.title: Great local wine bar disguised as a pizza joint (but with decent pizza too)
data.text: Wines tend to be from smaller vineyards and there's a good variety. Kale salad is delicious. Pizzas are all thin crust and you choose the toppings. The best part is the spice rack they bring out to you with the pizza -- all from the local Penzey's spice shop. You can try the usual toppings like red pepper flakes or go for something unusual like Turkish. And the lavender honey ice cream sandwich is wonderful. Service can be spotty but most of the time it's fine.

data.title: Excellent thin crust pizza
data.text: Always busy bar & restaurant. Excellent variety of wine. Great cheese bar. Great salads. Pizzas are somewhere between personal pizza size and small pizza. Extremely thin crust. Excellent. Service always good. Parking in a municipal lot across the street.

data.title: Wonderful thin crust pizza
data.text: Design your own pizza and and the gourmet spices to top it off. Wonderful salads are a nice compliment while waiting for your pie.

data.title: Unbelieveably good food and atmosphere
data.text: My family and I have long loved Fat Cat. We consider Tony and Suzanne Ancona, the owners and managers of this incredible restaurant, our good friends as they have shared their good nature, great food and incredible wine with us for over a decade. We love them and their clean and simple concept; love your customers, create a fun and comfortable environment for them, and give them exceptional fresh food and delicious unique wine. Can't wait to see them again.

data.title: Go-to dinner spot!
data.text: We always plan to go to Fat Cat for birthday dinners or celebrations. They have the most amazing gluten free pizzas. Even if you aren't gluten free, you should try them because they taste better than the original pizza bases! Great wine list as well. Can't go wrong !

data.title: Great Fare Great Atmosphere
data.text: This restaurant gets it right with a well considered selection of small plates and gourmet pizzas.  Family friendly and great for small gatherings.

data.title: Good to be different!
data.text: Indie one of a type pizza place. What's to love? The pizza is thin crust, good ingredients & nice combos (red onion, mushroom & sausage for eg). You get to build your own. The salads are simple fresh and healthy. The wine & beers offered are good & different. Fat Cat (I think) is connected to Fountainhead (wine & beer). Dessert. Cheese. Or a small selection of items like Butterscotch pudding. But that's it ! Don't be looking for anything else. It's pizza, salad, dessert, booze !!!  What's less compelling ? Decor is a little understated and can feel dark in there. Parking. You need to find the car park (I can't describe it here). Rainy. You're a walk away. Hardly hardships. You'll get a mix of a crowd.  Couple of nice big tables for big or multiple families. Vibrant bar scene for those that like that. Couples. Kids. The more I think about it the more I realize that people go there for the good food and relaxed vibe.  It is no show and no thrills.  Tony runs the place (you go one time you'll figure out who Tony is) with an interesting cast of characters. One of the servers is good for a birthday song opera style , the man on the cheese and desserts looks like he harbors a secret. It's great that you can find a place like this away from the main drag of SONO. If you find yourself drawn to Lilian August for shopping or the Garden Cinema and you're looking for a good spot to grab a bite & a drink, good option.  Consistently good. Unpretentious. Local feel.  Give it a go !!  Good pie at good prices.

data.title: Good food, a bit uncomfortable
data.text: Fat Cat has unusual pizzas and excellent salads and a wonderful selection of wines, plus very knowledgeable servers. The experience of eating there leaves something to be desired, for me, because of the noise and lack of comfortable seating. The wood and brick interior is aesthetically pleasing to the eye but makes for a noisy environment, which for me detracts from the pleasure of a meal. I found salads, however, to be truly refreshing and delicious. The menu is limited, so be forewarned.

data.title: Pizza is a forgotten child
data.text:
My wife and I went to try the pizza.  MISTAKE.

The pizza is thin...yes...small...yes....medium level cheese quality...yes
toppings....sparse...but OK tasting...service...good...

It seemed that most customers go to drink the wine and have something to munch on in between sipping and talking.  

Do not go for the pizza.

data.title: Thin pizza, excellent salads
data.text: The pizza is very specific and the toppings are not generous, but the salads more than make up for it. They are creative, fresh, and bountiful.

data.title: YUM! Great Pizza in Norwalk!
data.text: No offense, but Fat Cat Pie Co. puts Colony Pizza to shame! (I do love Colony Pizza but this is no competition) The pizza is so thin and crispy, and there are tons of options for toppings and spices. Fat Cat has a great selection of craft beers and I love that they serve them in wine glasses. I've come here twice recently and the first time it was empty at 5pm on a weeknight, but this time I visited on a Friday around 7:30 and it was packed but we did get a table for 3 without waiting. One pizza is enough for one very hungry person, but I could not finish a whole one myself. The service is great, really friendly staff. But the pizza is hands down the best I've had in Norwalk and surrounding area!

data.title: Good wine
data.text: Let's start with the wine, FatCat wine is excellent so don't bother with the wine list just get Fat Cat. Now for the Pizza, this is not your ordinary pizza, it's a thin almost cracker crust, but it is sooooo good. I am a NY transplant, and while this isn't NY pizza it one of the best you'll find in CT. Get one pie per three people. That some wine and an app. You'll be lovin life

data.title: Always soemthing interesting to eat
data.text: Especially liked their pizzas, which are thin crusted and have a nice variety of unexpected toppings. Also liked the salad choices and the cheese plates.

data.title: Something different, and very yummy!
data.text:
I never thought I could eat a whole pizza!! Theirs is a different and tastier, even healthier style and it's one of my favorite places.

I love their spice box, though toppings could be more varied.

data.title: Okay
data.text: The pizza is good, not great. The rest of the food is average, the atmosphere is very noisy making it hard to hold a conversation
